programme.title: Burn Pile Murder Trial
programme.desc: According to prosecutors in their opening statements, money was the motive for this murder. Next, Melody Farris' defense delivered their opening remarks to the jury. They claimed police acted on confirmation bias when they allegedly narrowed erroneously on the defendant for the death of her husband, Gary. A complicated family coupled with a complicated police investigation all led to fingers pointing at Melody Farris for first-degree murder.

programme.title: Burn Pile Murder Trial
programme.desc: Melody Farris was accused of killing her husband, Gary Farris, and then burning his remains on their property. Prosecutors contended the couple's 38-year marriage had turned rocky over money and Melody had begun extramarital affairs.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: It may have seemed as if the DNA evidence was piling up against O.J. Simpson in the deaths of his ex-wife Nicole and her friend Ronald Goldman. DNA analyst Gary Sims pulled out all the stops when testifying to the jury.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.sub-title: More Substantiation on the DNA Evidence
programme.desc: Jurors heard from two DNA experts about their test results on blood linked to the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: DNA helps determine the probability that it came from someone in particular. You can also exclude others as the source. The State wanted jurors to understand what the DNA showed about the likelihood that O.J. Simpson was at the crime scene.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: Jurors again heard about what's called population genetics. The experts in this case got into specifics to try to explain the DNA evidence linked to the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: Prosecutors questioned their DNA analyst about contamination. For months, O.J.'s defense team had made allegations that the LAPD had mishandled and tainted the evidence linked to the deaths of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: The Prosecution had some hypothetical questions for DNA analyst Gary Sims. The strategy here was to try to head off the Defense's anticipated line of attack.

programme.title: CA v. O.J. Simpson
programme.desc: Right out the gate during cross-examination, O.J. Simpson's defense went straight to challenging the qualifications and experience of the DNA analyst Gary Sims who worked for the California Department of Justice.
